title: Drawing, "Studies for Four Statues and Seven Masks", ca. 1800–25
medium:
Pen and dark brown ink, brush and brown wash on cream laid paper 
Support: cream laid paper, lined and laid down
markings: Stamps: Verso, in black ink: Museum for the Arts of Decoration Cooper Union
inscribed: Inscribed at the base of the statues, from left to right: DIANA, CERERE, CERERE, FLORA
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Sheet divided roughly into upper and lower parts. Upper part includes studies of four full-length sculptured figures, each labelled by name, proceding from left to right: Diana; 2 views of Ceres; Flora. Seven grotesque masks are arrayed horizontally across bottom part of sheet.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Studies for Four Statues and Seven Masks", ca. 1800–25.
ca. 1800–25. Pen and dark brown ink, brush and brown wash on cream laid paper 
Support: cream laid paper, lined and laid down. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2092.
